definition: unlucky/inauspicious/ominous
(negative prefix)/not/no
lucky/giga- (meaning billion or 10^9)
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]
ominous

sentences.english: There are many theories of the origin of this superstition of wishing luck to the actors, but here are a few
sentences.chinese: 關於祝演員好運帶來不吉的迷信的起源有很多說法。

sentences.english: I said to the old monk with smile that I am afraid the crow’s cry may be ominous for us.
sentences.chinese: 我笑對老僧說，老鴉叫恐有不吉。

sentences.english: Some also think that the tiger year is not good for men.
sentences.chinese: 有人還認爲白虎年對男人也不吉。

definition: fateful accident/inauspicious matter (involving death or casualties)
bankrupt/to suffer financial loss
the 12 earthly branches 子[zi3], 丑[chou3], 寅[yin2], 卯[mao3], 辰[chen2], 巳[si4], 午[wu3], 未[wei4], 申[shen1], 酉[you3], 戌[xu1], 亥[hai4], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth
typical weather in a given season
good and bad luck (in astrology)
the 10 heavenly stems 甲[jia3], 乙[yi3], 丙[bing3], 丁[ding1], 戊[wu4], 己[ji3], 庚[geng1], 辛[xin1], 壬[ren2], 癸[gui3], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
the character 8 or 八/birthdate characters used in fortune-telling
10th earthly branch: 5-7 p.m., 8th solar month (8th September-7th October), year of the Rooster/ancient Chinese compass point: 270° (west)
11th earthly branch: 7-9 p.m., 9th solar month (8th October-6th November), year of the Dog/ancient Chinese compass point: 300°
see 屈戌兒|屈戌儿[qu1 qu5 er5]
the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1] and twelve earthly branches 十二枝/sexagenary cycle
auspicious event
Year 8, year of the Ram (e.g. 2003)
Year 11, year of the Dog (e.g. 2006)
the Yuezhi, an ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty (also written 月氏[Yue4 zhi1])
very auspicious/extremely lucky
